RelatedSentence: ( CNN ) -- Clashes near the northern Malian town of Kidal between government forces and Tuareg rebel armed groups have left eight Malian soldiers dead and 25 others injured , according to the country 's Defense Ministry , the state - run newspaper , L'Essor National , reported Sunday .
There were also 28 dead and 62 wounded on the Tuareg side , the ministry said , according to L'Essor National .
The government issued a statement Saturday saying Tuareg rebels from the Azawad National Liberation Movement , joined by jihadists , attacked government buildings .
The government issued a statement Saturday saying Tuareg rebels from the Azawad National Liberation Movement , joined by jihadists , attacked government buildings .

A0: The Azawad National Liberation Movement -- known as the MNLA , the initials for its name in French --
RelatedSentence: The Azawad National Liberation Movement -- known as the MNLA , the initials for its name in French -- is fighting for independence for the northern part of Mali , a region that it refers to as Azawad .
The MNLA issued a statement about the violence , describing it as self - defense and resistance .
The MNLA issued a statement about the violence , describing it as self - defense and resistance .
The group claimed it took 30 prisoners , including 24 soldiers and three regional government officials .
The group claimed it took 30 prisoners , including 24 soldiers and three regional government officials .
Two wounded Malian soldiers were handed over to the International Committee of the Red Cross , the MNLA added .
The United Nations Mission in Mali condemned the clashes and said they violated the preliminary accords designed to bring peace and security in the northern regions , including in Kidal .
